verses.text: 法利賽人和撒都該人前來試探耶穌，求他顯個從天上來的神蹟給他們看。

words.note: Often implies testing with malicious intent in biblical context.
A general measure word, often used as an indefinite article.
Here indicates origin, 'from heaven'.

verses.text: 耶穌回答：「黃昏的時候，你們說：『天色通紅，明天一定是晴天。』
早上的時候，你們說：『天色又紅又暗，今天一定有風雨。』你們知道分辨天色，卻不能分辨時代的徵兆嗎？

words.note: Used in '又...又...' structure meaning 'both X and Y'.
Here refers to the current spiritual or historical period.

verses.text: 邪惡和淫亂的世代要尋求神蹟，除了約拿的神蹟之外，不會有甚麼神蹟給它了。」耶穌就離開他們走了。

words.note: Indicates completion or change of state.
Indicates completion of action.

verses.text: 門徒到了對岸，忘記了帶餅。

words.note: Indicates completion of action.
Indicates completion or a new situation.
In biblical context, often refers to bread or flatbread.

verses.heading: The Yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees

verses.text: 耶穌對他們說：「你們要小心，提防法利賽人和撒都該人的酵。」

words.note: Figurative for corrupting influence or false teaching in the Bible.

verses.text: 他們就彼此議論說：「這是因為我們沒有帶餅吧。」
耶穌知道了，就說：「小信的人，為甚麼議論沒有餅這件事呢？

words.note: Used to describe people with insufficient faith, common in the Bible.

verses.text: 你們還不明白嗎？你們是不是忘記了那五個餅分給五千人，又裝滿了多少個籃子呢？

words.definition: is it or is it not
words.note: Used to form a yes/no question, similar to 'whether or not'.

verses.text: 還是忘記了那七個餅分給四千人，又裝滿了多少個大籃子呢？
我對你們講的不是餅的事，你們為甚麼不明白？你們要提防法利賽人和撒都該人的酵。」

words.note: Figuratively, influence or teaching.

verses.text: 這時他們才領會耶穌說的不是要提防餅酵，而是要提防法利賽人和撒都該人的教訓。

words.note: Refers to the physical leaven for bread.
Refers to doctrine or moral instruction.

verses.text: 耶穌來到該撒利亞．腓立比的地區，就問自己的門徒：「人說人子是誰？」

words.note: Refers to a follower, especially of a religious teacher.
A title used by Jesus for himself.

verses.heading: Peter’s Confession

verses.text: 他們回答：「有人說是施洗的約翰，有人說是以利亞，也有人說是耶利米，或是先知裡的一位。」

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.

verses.text: 他問他們：「你們說我是誰？」
西門．彼得回答：「你是基督，是永生 神的兒子。」

words.note: Title meaning 'anointed one'
The preceding space is a reverential mark in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 耶穌對他說：「約拿的兒子西門，你是有福的，因為這不是人（「人」原文作「肉和血」）指示你的，而是我在天上的父啟示你的。

words.note: Used reverentially for God in this context.

verses.text: 我告訴你，你是彼得，我要在這磐石上建立我的教會，死亡的權勢（「死亡的權勢」原文作「陰間的門」）不能勝過他。

words.note: Refers to a large, firm rock.

verses.text: 我要把天國的鑰匙給你，你在地上捆綁的，在天上也被捆綁；你在地上釋放的，在天上也被釋放。」

words.note: Introduces the direct object before the verb.
Forms a nominal phrase from the preceding clause.

verses.text: 於是耶穌吩咐門徒不可對人說他就是基督。

words.note: Title meaning 'anointed one'

verses.text: 從那時起，耶穌開始向門徒指出，他必須往耶路撒冷去，受長老、祭司長和經學家許多的苦害，並且被殺，第三天復活。

words.note: Used with 從 to indicate starting point.
Follower or student of a religious teacher.
A holy city in the Middle East.
An office in the early church and Jewish community.
High-ranking priests in the Jewish temple.
Experts in Jewish law, often associated with the Pharisees.
Refers to harm or affliction endured.
Refers to the day of Christ's resurrection.

verses.heading: First Prediction of Jesus’ Death and Resurrection

verses.text: 彼得就把他拉到一邊，責怪他說：「主啊，千萬不可這樣，這事一定不會發生在你身上的。」

words.note: One of Jesus' twelve disciples.
Indicates consequence or immediacy.
Used to bring the object before the verb.
Indicates reaching a destination or result.
Title of respect and reverence for God/Jesus.
Implies a strong warning or prohibition, 'by no means'.

verses.text: 耶穌轉過來對彼得說：「撒但！退到我後面去！你是絆腳石，因為你不思念 神的事，只思念人的事。」

words.note: A directional compound verb.
Indicates the object of an action or speech.
Hebrew for 'adversary', often personified as the devil.
Indicates reaching a destination or result.
A metaphor for something that causes one to falter in faith.
To fix one's thoughts on something.
Capitalized 'S' in pinyin for reverence; the space before 神 is an honorific common in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 於是耶穌對門徒說：「如果有人願意跟從我，就當捨己，背起他的十字架來跟從我。

words.note: Indicates a sequence of events or conclusion.
Correlates with `如果` (if) to indicate a consequence.
A core concept of Christian discipleship.
Symbol of suffering, sacrifice, and ultimately, salvation.
Used here as a directional/purpose complement.

verses.text: 凡是想救自己生命的，必喪掉生命；但為我犧牲生命的，必得著生命。

words.note: Used to introduce a generalization or inclusive statement.
Can refer to physical life or eternal life, depending on context.
Turns the preceding clause into a noun phrase, e.g., 'those who...'
A resultative verb meaning to lose completely or irrevocably.
To give up something for a greater cause or value.
Turns the preceding clause into a noun phrase, e.g., 'those who...'
A resultative verb emphasizing successful attainment.

verses.text: 人若賺得全世界，卻賠上自己的生命，有甚麼好處呢？人還能用甚麼換回自己的生命呢？

words.note: A verb-resultative compound meaning 'to earn and succeed in getting'.
A verb-complement construction meaning 'to lose completely'.
Also written 什麼 (shénme).
Also written 什麼 (shénme).
A verb-complement construction meaning 'to exchange to get back'.

verses.text: 人子要在父的榮耀裡和眾天使一同降臨，那時他要照各人的行為報應各人。

words.note: A self-designation used by Jesus in the Gospels.
Used as an auxiliary verb indicating future tense or intention.
Refers to God the Father in this context.
Often used with 在 to form a prepositional phrase like 'in the...' (在...裡).
Literally 'heavenly messenger'.
Often refers to a divine or majestic arrival.
Used as an auxiliary verb indicating future tense or intention.
Often implies divine retribution or consequences for actions.

verses.text: 我實在告訴你們，站在這裡的，有人在沒有嘗過死味以前，必要看見人子帶著他的國降臨。」

words.note: Nominalizes the preceding phrase '站在這裡' (standing here).
Used to introduce a time phrase, often with '以前'.
Indicates having experienced something in the past.
A poetic or metaphorical expression for experiencing death.
Used with 在 to form '在...以前' (before...).
Strongly emphasizes the certainty of an action.
A verb-resultative compound indicating successful seeing.
A self-designation used by Jesus in the Gospels.
Here implies 'accompanied by' or 'bringing along'.
Indicates a continuous state or action.
Often refers to the Kingdom of God/Heaven in a biblical context.
Often refers to a divine or majestic arrival.
